Posts.Content: May 19, 2011 12:53AM StaceyLynn wrote: Hi Kari, Waiting can be so stressful. Fear and concern are normal. Why do doctors dismiss lumps in breasts as if they know for sure it's benign without doing a biopsy? About 3 - 4 months before my diagnosis, I had a painful, swollen node in the groin area. My neurologist was concerned after viewing the node via ultrasound (I was being checked for blood clots in my legs.) don't want to add to your concerns, but I wanted to share my experience. Sending positive thoughts your way.
Posts.Title: Am I crazy or being paranoid? Opinions PLEASE! kookers1 vmudrow

Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2011 12:54AM StaceyLynn wrote: If you have insurance I think it's covered with a prescription from your doctor. The only other resource I know is the American Cancer Society's TLC catalogue. I'm 3 months out from my BMX. (no recon) I had an easy recovery and I wish you the same.

Well, I'm half-way through chemo and I'm just realizing that chemo infusions are not covered 100% by my insurance even after meeting the deductible and yearly out-of-pocket. The bills are coming in... Hope everyone's doing well.

Posts.Content: Jul 23, 2011 05:52PM StaceyLynn wrote: I hope everyone's doing ok. I'm so fatigued and just can't really read the discussion thread to catch up. July 12th I had my 3rd infusion and the side effects are growing. First, aweful leg pain and fluid retention. These have calmed down, but today I noticed my eyelids are swollen and it's painful to open my eyes so I've been squiinting all day. In addition, I have rectal bleeding probably from constipation/hemmoroids/ fissure. (Sorry if that's TMI). My concern is that the blood is in clots. I had a colonoscopy in April of this year and it was clear. All of this makes me want to skip the last chemo treatment, but I won't. Thanks ladies for allowing me space to vent my concerns. When I'm able I'll catch up. In the meantime, do you think I should call the onc who's on call or wait until Monday and call the office?
